line_1: Catch'd by the eye, no more shall stop
line_2: At Wildey's toys, or Pinchbeck's shop;

line_1: Or Flavia been content to stop
line_2: At triumphs in a Fleet-street shop!

line_1: Projecting thatch the woodbine's branches stop,
line_2: And turn their blossoms to the casement's top:

line_1: When thus enrich'd, he chose at home to stop
line_2: And fleece his neighbours in a new-built shop;

line_1: Some cock or cat, your rage maun stop,
line_2: When MASONS' mystic word an' grip,

line_1: Some cock or cat, your rage maun stop,
line_2: In storms an' tempests raise you up,

line_1: Some cock or cat, your rage maun stop,
line_2: The youngest Brother ye wad whip
DEAR shade of bliss, enchanting hope,

line_1: Bade with cold streams the quick expansion stop,
line_2: And sunk the immense of vapour to a drop. —

line_1: The travell'd fool your mouth will stop,
line_2: Whatever word you chance to drop,

line_1: To all my measures puts a stop:
line_2: Whene'er I talk of packing up,

line_1: You fly, invoke the Gods; then turning, stop
line_2: To rail; she singing, still whirls on her Mop.

line_1: "And mark, what varying fates their plunders stop
line_2: " Who robb'd a nation, and who robb'd a shop.
